data.text:
Get this 👉 It would take ~9 weeks to transmit a complete map of Mars back to Earth with current radio frequency systems.

With lasers, it would take ~9 days

💥 Learn about our laser communications demo launching soon to empower future discoveries: https://t.co/5NYQ84OnBc https://t.co/KrCXl1TZ5s

📡 We've long partnered with industry to provide communications and navigation services in space. In the latest "Invisible Network" podcast, @NASASCaN experts explain how we're bringing new commmercial companies into the market.

📲 Listen & subscribe: https://t.co/2a0kIBVflB https://t.co/Rs17X8Z3Gw

🔴 🚁 Our Ingenuity #MarsHelicopter, but make it 3D!

When the helicopter took to the Martian skies on its third flight, @NASAPersevere was there to capture it all. Check out the rendered flight in 3D as it ascends, hovers, then zooms laterally: https://t.co/YVY07InRKu https://t.co/dAR37lBONk

👋 Goodbye, asteroid Bennu! Yesterday, our #OSIRISREx spacecraft took a final image before departing for the journey back to Earth. In 2023, it'll arrive back at our home planet, delivering a sample of rocks & dust captured from the asteroid: https://t.co/Esy6uJMGu0 https://t.co/GN8CqSv7P0

During #AsianAmericanPacificIslanderHeritageMonth, we take time to recognize the amazing contributions of past and present employees of #AAPI descent. Hear from some of the resilient spirits who help power our missions every day: https://t.co/ijuQdWO7he https://t.co/6sHevzm7gH

RT @NASAArmstrong: The X- 57 is on its way! ✈️ 

The propellers on the X-57 Maxwell aircraft spin for the first time under electric power f…

Our @NASAPersevere Mars rover has begun studying the floor of Jezero Crater, which held a lake billions of years ago. Eventually, the rover will collect rock samples that might hold evidence of ancient microbial life: https://t.co/9g30kTbLpH https://t.co/oSHP3bC6CR

TODAY: The golden mirror on the world’s largest and most powerful space telescope – @NASAWebb – opened for the last time on Earth. 

✨🚀 Get the details about this important milestone ahead of the mission’s Oct. 31 launch: https://t.co/ibLwQsMJ0m https://t.co/UBIJVf6FnC

🔊 From 14.1 billion miles from Earth, the Voyager 1 spacecraft has detected a new cosmic “hum” in interstellar space from the Plasma Wave System instrument aboard the craft! 

🌊 Learn about what this fascinating discovery means to us here on Earth: https://t.co/2yANyhRxQw https://t.co/V333x2A74J
RT @NASA_Technology: 📺LIVE 11 a.m. ET: NASA Senior Advisor @blal will provide the keynote @NASAArtemis update at the Lunar Surface Innovati…

🤩 Mon., May 10: From Virginia, we're set to launch a mission to explore energy transport in space. If skies are clear, you may see it in the Eastern U.S.

🚀 Liftoff is now no earlier than 8:04pm ET, w/a 40-min. window. 

➡️ Follow @NASA_Wallops for news: https://t.co/Cz2jHt0iql https://t.co/f2hm3oYSD0

😎 Have 3D glasses? It's time to dust them off… for science! 

Researchers at @NASA_Langley are using 3D modeling to better understand and measure severe weather. See weather satellite imagery like you've never seen it before ➡️: https://t.co/xcO7twLzB8 https://t.co/2AXnChmxsw
RT @ulalaunch: In 2016, @NASASolarSystem #OSIRISREx’s historic journey to a near-Earth asteroid began as it lifted off on a ULA #AtlasV. Ne…

After nearly 5 years in space, @NASASolarSystem's #OSIRISREx mission is heading to Earth with a sample of rocks & dust from a 4.5-billion-year-old asteroid! 

🪨 ▪️▪️▪️🛰️▪️▪️▪️ 🌎  

Check out how its mission #ToBennuAndBack exceeded our expectations: https://t.co/91n38cmQNA https://t.co/bxtT0uXeu3
RT @NASASolarSystem: Mission navigation has received confirmation of burn cutoff. #OSIRISREx is headed home with a souvenir of rocks and du…

🤘 LIVE: Rock on! Join us as @NASASolarSystem's #OSIRISREx mission bids farewell to asteroid Bennu. The spacecraft will fire its thrusters & start its journey home, carrying precious asteroid material that it will return to Earth in 2023: 
#ToBennuAndBack https://t.co/9sJCq6lCEz

RT @NASAAstrobio: 👋 So long and thanks for all the science!

Join us today at 4pm ET as @NASASolarSystem's #OSIRISREx mission bids farewell…

Administrator @SenBillNelson announced that @Astro_CabanaBob will serve as our associate administrator, effective Mon., May 17. Mr. Cabana has served as the director of @NASAKennedy since 2008: https://t.co/izMMmB2po8 https://t.co/VSQCtjbWuI

News: Steve Jurczyk, who served as our acting administrator from Jan. 20 to May 3, 2021, and associate administrator since May 2018, will retire on Fri., May 14, after more than three decades of service to the agency: https://t.co/MxdEFtrImX https://t.co/JyR4eRrtCl

LISTEN IN: Experts from @Axiom_Space and NASA discuss details about the first private astronaut mission to the @Space_Station, slated for no earlier than January 2022: https://t.co/z1RgZwQkWS

More: https://t.co/fxlUYjTFIg https://t.co/goPLw5Y8UX

Tomorrow, our @NASASolarSystem OSIRIS-REx mission departs asteroid Bennu, carrying a sample of rocks & dust for return to Earth. Set a reminder to watch live at 4pm ET as the spacecraft begins its journey home: https://t.co/L4alRfju1k
#ToBennuAndBack https://t.co/68uLNEYv7e

An image worth hundreds of galaxies 💫

Observed by @NASAHubble, this image features Abell 3827, a galaxy cluster that cosmologists study to reveal more about dark matter — one of the greatest puzzles faced today. Discover more: https://t.co/OqpmLvhR2F https://t.co/RVcXsJ0Upx

“Spacecraft are dependent on us in their first year as we bond. They tend to throw tantrums in their next couple of years, but we love them anyway.”

At NASA, mothers and Mission Operation Managers (MOMs) happen to have a lot in common. Happy Mother's Day: https://t.co/lxZEwcop0w https://t.co/cekTlASEVj

NASA Administrator @SenBillNelson on debris from the Chinese Long March 5B rocket: “Spacefaring nations must minimize the risks to people and property on Earth of re-entries of space objects and maximize transparency regarding those operations."

More: https://t.co/YUW0cB96he https://t.co/ZxSDm035vA

📣 🎶 Are you a musician inspired by exploration & discovery? Break out your favorite musical instrument!

We'd love for your voice to be part of the #NASALucySoundscape, a public collection of original tunes inspired by our #LucyMission launching in 2021: https://t.co/KHQttJb6np https://t.co/012D3lFBy8

🐦 Tracking birds from space! The Avian Migration Aerial Surface Space project uses astronaut photos from the @Space_Station to trace bird migrations across the planet. The images map routes taken by seven endangered or threatened bird species: https://t.co/yr3t4JJ0I0 https://t.co/b7J7DozNxa

As the first Asian American to fly in space, Ellison Onizuka was a trail blazer who inspired many. In light of #AAPIHM, dive into Onizuka’s amazing journey with NASA in this @GoogleArts feature: https://t.co/CPUkzJGEVm https://t.co/bJJsitwsjm
RT @NASA_Johnson: As we near the launch of the @NASA_SLS and the @NASA_Orion spacecraft for Artemis, the lead launch director for this firs…
RT @hitRECordJoe: In episode 3 of #CreateTogether, I got the opportunity to sit down with a @NASA Scientist and talk about the connection b…

🪂 Crew-1 returns home after a record-breaking mission
✋ @SenBillNelson is sworn in as NASA's new administrator
✈️ Our experimental all-electric airplane undergoes voltage testing

All that and more in our latest episode of This Week @ NASA: https://t.co/mTxDhSb1Xu https://t.co/1nJ9X19EiR
RT @NASAJPL: Excelsior! The #MarsHelicopter completed its 1st one-way trip and 5th flight on Mars. It touched down at its new location, kic…

On Tues., May 11 at 10:15am ET, students from Brownsville, Texas will have an opportunity to ask @Astro_Kimbrough & @Thom_Astro questions, and learn about science & research on the @Space_Station. How to watch the live Earth-to-space call: https://t.co/SddfNwb8T3 https://t.co/jOvvfBLrcm

For #AAPIHM, we are celebrating @NASAPersevere mission commentator and guidance, navigation, and controls operations Lead Swati Mohan. Her work is part of the first mission to collect and cache Martian rock and regolith. Meet Swati: https://t.co/WflSTk7Hrc https://t.co/lxwKZI2Ria

We’re partnering with @Axiom_Space to enable the first private astronaut mission to the @Space_Station! 

📅 Get the details from mission experts during a LIVE update on May 10 at 11am ET (15:00 UT).

How to tune in: https://t.co/3GPZHJXGKS https://t.co/Fr5kD0C9mg

🪐⏰ The space clock is tick...tick...ticking! Today’s the final day to cast your vote for the 2021 Webby Awards, and we are up for six. 

➡️ Get to know the projects and vote: https://t.co/wGZdVwaJoT https://t.co/cq5tDD3svI

LIVE NOW: As we prepare to send astronauts to the Moon through the @NASAArtemis program, we are testing the @NASA_Orion crew capsule that will take them there and back! Our experts are taking your questions on @Reddit until 3pm ET: https://t.co/3QG6YT3DOy https://t.co/CnBywoCgRm

This week...

🪂  Four humans successfully returned to Earth
🔬 @Space_Station astronauts investigate tissue chips
🧑‍🚀 Shane Kimbrough of @NASA_Astronauts researches space debris

Get the details about these stories in this new episode of #SpaceToGround: https://t.co/kG5lqku1Ia https://t.co/2Tcd5PnWiI

🔊🔴 New sounds from Mars: Our @NASAPersevere rover caught the beats coming from our Ingenuity #MarsHelicopter! This marks the first time a spacecraft on another planet has recorded the sounds of a separate spacecraft. 

🎧🚁 Turn the volume up: https://t.co/o7zG6mQJzx https://t.co/s8Hm3dhcgg

Live in the Eastern U.S.? You may be able to see a launch from @NASAWallops! A suborbital sounding rocket is set for liftoff no earlier than Sat., May 8 at 8:02pm ET, with a mission to explore energy transport in space. 

🤩 Where & when to look up: https://t.co/49gYTlhGQq https://t.co/ZtLtk5jNlt

Last October, our OSIRIS-REx spacecraft touched down & captured a sample of asteroid Bennu. 

On Mon., May 10 at 4pm ET, it begins the next stage of its journey #ToBennuAndBack: a two-year cruise home to Earth. Tune in live: https://t.co/rvNdnCzegl https://t.co/kEeicxwibO
RT @NASASolarSystem: Are you a musician inspired by exploration & discovery? Share your inspiration in your unique voice, and join with oth…
RT @SOFIAtelescope: May is #AAPIHeritageMonth! Project scientist Naseem Rangwala leads our scientific research & was one of the first women…
RT @NASAJPL: Off to new places! The #MarsHelicopter is slated for its fifth flight on May 7, with data coming down at 4:31pm PT (7:31pm ET)…

"I felt like those cartoons when they experience [g-forces] and your face is just sagging down.” - @AstroVicGlover recounting his first experience reentering Earth aboard @SpaceX’s Crew Dragon Resilience. https://t.co/j0W0ls0Ti6

Is it more harrowing to splash down at night? Crew-1 astronaut Shannon Walker says everybody was so well prepared, it was no different for the crew when they splashed down on May 2. https://t.co/0l1in44fUZ

“I think we all need to be able to dream in all colors." – @AstroVicGlover offers his perspective on being the first Black astronaut to embark on a long-duration spaceflight aboard NASA's @SpaceX Crew-1 mission. https://t.co/nOmBwGtSJK

"It's purely a joy," says @Astro_Soichi about welcoming new crew members aboard the @Space_Station. On April 23, his @JAXA_en colleague @Aki_Hoshide launched on NASA's @SpaceX Crew-2 mission and arrived at the orbiting laboratory. https://t.co/JRQ22RVjfO

“Quite frankly, I don’t know how our mission could have gone any better.” - @Astro_illini praises the teams across NASA, @SpaceX, and partner agencies who helped make Crew-1 a success. https://t.co/c7pW2cPY58
LIVE: NASA’s @SpaceX Crew-1 astronauts give their first update after returning to Earth. Have questions? Use #AskNASA. https://t.co/pWvaHVPi8n

RT @Commercial_Crew: 🐉 @NASA's @SpaceX Crew-1 astronauts are back on planet Earth and ready to answer your questions!

Join us today at 3:4…

HAPPENING NOW: @NASAEarth and university scientists answer your questions on @Reddit! 🌳👉 Don’t miss this opportunity to talk directly to experts involved with tree science and how they can regulate climate change. Submit your ?s here: https://t.co/YBEZVz4bTb https://t.co/KweLVIRE5V
RT @Commercial_Crew: Launch Alert 🚀 @NASA and @BoeingSpace are targeting Friday, July 30 at 2:53 p.m. ET for the launch of the Orbital Flig…
RT @NASAInterns: We are proud to celebrate Asian American & Pacific Islander Heritage Month w/ @NASAPeople who contribute to @NASA missions…

See the iconic golden mirror of @NASAWebb for the last time on Earth during a virtual briefing Tues., May 11 at 1pm ET. Hear NASA & @NorthropGrumman officials discuss the mission’s next steps.

👉 Questions? Use #NASAWebb.
Get more details: https://t.co/hnZ3kCp5CU https://t.co/ba2ie7nnMa

🪐🦈 From alien planets to whale sharks, six of our projects have been nominated for the 2021 Webby Awards! 

🗳️ Have a look at the nominees and cast your vote by Friday, May 7!: https://t.co/GczY3mSLKo https://t.co/9rABoXg6gW

📡 @NASASCaN provides communications & navigation in space, including for @Commercial_Crew. On the new episode of our "Invisible Network" podcast, engineers describe their role in ensuring the success of the first Crew Dragon flights with astronauts: https://t.co/oxJIUIdvNK https://t.co/RDz0UAqPR5

On Thurs., May 6 at 10:30am ET, students from New York will join a live Earth-to-space call with @Astro_Megan & @Thom_Astro on the @Space_Station. How to watch: https://t.co/0Nrs71GoEa https://t.co/RKSVzDAYmi

60 years ago today, astronaut Alan Shepard became the first American to travel in space, climbing ~116 miles (188 km) above Earth! Shortly after, President John F. Kennedy committed the United States to a lunar landing before the end of the decade: https://t.co/1syroEq84g https://t.co/TO1GtAUgZA
RT @NASA_APPEL: Dive into our new 🎙️ ep., 'Spacecraft Window Design,' with Lynda Estes—@NASA_Orion's and @Commercial_Crew's expert on space…
LIVE: Teacher-turned-astronaut @Astro_Ricky describes his career journey and answers questions: https://t.co/ak8jNgTImV
RT @NASA_Technology: The government is getting America's small businesses back on track! We invest millions of dollars in them each year an…

NOW: To mark the 60th anniversary of Americans in space, @NASAHistory and @AirAndSpace experts are answering your questions on @Reddit about the history of human spaceflight: https://t.co/FvLoCqPfQb https://t.co/aUDMevX3MX

@visimpressa Good question! There are no orbiters around Titan to help transmit. Therefore, Dragonfly will use direct-to-Earth communications & beam all uplink and downlink communications from its antenna directly to NASA’s Deep Space Network. Find out more: https://t.co/xImh4AspkF

RT @NASAhistory: Some heroes don't wear spacesuits!

Alan Shepard's flight wouldn't have been possible without mathematician Katherine John…

LIVE: A look at 60 years of Americans in space, with our head of human spaceflight @KathyLueders, experts from @NASAHistory and @AirAndSpace, with remarks from @Astro_Jeanette: https://t.co/z1RgZwQkWS

At 12pm ET (16:00 UT), join us on @Reddit's r/history to learn more. https://t.co/8y7LtxLIG8

“What a beautiful view.”

Alan Shepard became the first American in space 60 years ago (May 5, 1961) when Freedom 7 lifted off atop a Mercury-Redstone rocket. The 15-minute flight gave us valuable data on how humans respond to microgravity: https://t.co/j7XdaOccRt https://t.co/yHZKsspHGd

📺 Starting at 8:30am, watch archival footage and a replay of the May 5, 1961 launch broadcast. 

🚀 At 11am, join @NASAHistory and @AirAndSpace for a discussion on six decades of American spaceflight. 

💻 And at 12pm, they'll answer your ?s on @Reddit: 

https://t.co/z1RgZwQkWS https://t.co/kWxA0VVlgn

Tomorrow marks the 60th anniversary of Alan Shepard's historic flight aboard Freedom 7, making him the first American in space. Here a short thread on how you can celebrate with us (all times Eastern) ⬇️ https://t.co/dcnlopXJAl

We've discovered thousands of exoplanets (planets beyond our solar system).

🌋 Lava planets ✅
🥚 Egg-shaped worlds ✅
☀️☀️ Planets with multiple suns ✅
⚫ ️Planets with no sun at all! ✅

What can we learn from all this weird, wondrous variety? https://t.co/spiXTKssBh https://t.co/mmw1MEGdTU

Teachers open up our universe! 💫
Whether in-person or on a screen, educators everywhere have adapted and continued to inspire and challenge the next generation of explorers to reach for the stars: https://t.co/c3He8noGVQ

From the @Space_Station, happy #TeacherAppreciationWeek! https://t.co/h1mlDlbYR5

🚁🔴 WATCH: On the latest edition of #NASAScience Live, we discuss the exciting future of extraterrestrial flight with experts from the Ingenuity #MarsHelicopter team and upcoming Dragonfly mission team. 

Have Qs? Use #AskNASA: https://t.co/7jn1Zc4cvD
RT @NASAAstrobio: What’s next for the future of extraterrestrial flight? Join experts to learn about #MarsHelicopter and @NASA’s upcoming #…

RT @NASASolarSystem: On #StarWarsDay, let us remind you the odds of successfully navigating an asteroid field are…quite good. 
- #OSIRISREx…

RT @NASASTEM: What's better than one #NASASTEM Stars episode?🤔 TWO new NASA STEM Stars episodes!🤩
 
🔭 @NASAWebb Astrophysicist Dr. Kartik S…

In a galaxy far, far away…
Skywalker’s home planet Tatooine in “Star Wars,” which orbited 2 stars, wasn't just cinematic invention. Thanks to our @NASAUniverse missions, we’re able to learn more about binary stars. Take a look & #MaytheFourthBeWithYou: https://t.co/YR3tVuxE0O https://t.co/Zww4CBFFxX
RT @NASAHubble: #MayThe4thBeWithYou! Hubble captured this view of a celestial “lightsaber” that’s called HH 24. But it’s not in a galaxy fa…

RT @NASAGoddard: Tired of looking in Alderaan places for your inspiration?

Check out our SVS. These *are* the visuals you’re looking for.…

In 1977, Star Wars introduced the two-sun, “circumbinary” planet Tatooine — but astronomers didn’t know such solar systems existed.

🤯 Decades later, they began finding them! Our TESS mission discovered this two-sun planet in 2020: https://t.co/XV7JmdbFTy

#MayTheFourthBeWithYou https://t.co/vBbAqzVpcK

📸 NEW PHOTO DROP: We've released new images from the @SpaceX Crew Dragon Endeavour's May 2 splashdown with Crew-1 astronauts @AstroVicGlover, @Astro_illini, Shannon Walker, & @Astro_Soichi!

🤩 Check ‘em out via @NASAHQPhoto: https://t.co/431JM1SYtj https://t.co/4FspWV6npy

Today, @SenBillNelson was sworn in as our new administrator by @VP Kamala Harris. As our 14th administrator, Nelson will lead our mission of exploration and innovation. More: https://t.co/mSRkgsCRrA https://t.co/8PqWO3MsIC

After 168 days in space, NASA’s @SpaceX Crew-1 astronauts arrived home on May 2. 

📅 On May 6 at 3:45pm ET (19:45 UT), hear from the crew LIVE during their first Q&A back on Earth. 

Submit your ?s about their historic mission using #AskNASA. Details: https://t.co/NqtnyW475M https://t.co/BbsEYpAPwA
RT @NASAhistory: In celebration of Alan Shepard's historic flight and the past 60 years of Americans in space, @NASAhistory & @airandspace…

➡️ Media accreditation is open for the launch of the next @SpaceX delivery of @ISS_Research, supplies, & more to the @Space_Station, targeted for June 3! This will be the second cargo resupply mission on the upgraded version of the Dragon spacecraft: https://t.co/6MCwymcUGy https://t.co/URNCNfJoDC
RT @VP: .@NASA is critical to U.S. national and economic security. With decades of experience and as a former astronaut, Bill Nelson will a…

LIVE NOW: @NASAUniverse experts answer your questions on @Reddit!
 
🔭 Ask them anything about how they use an X-ray telescope on the @Space_Station to study the remnants of massive exploded stars, environments around black holes, & other cosmic phenomena: https://t.co/35UHwbxPny https://t.co/IyIzasPckM
RT @nasahqphoto: Former Senator Bill Nelson was ceremonially sworn in as the 14th @NASA Administrator today by @VP Kamala Harris. Check out…
RT @AstroVicGlover: Home! Mission Complete. https://t.co/dVqCjF1UUd

"With my disability, people tend to make assumptions about what I can and can’t do." In a new episode of our #GravityAssist podcast, hear Dana Bolles discuss how she has dealt with other people's assumptions, and her passion for inspiring students in STEM: https://t.co/01Guw9X12c https://t.co/RTCC29TvWh

Let’s give NASA's @SpaceX Crew-1 astronauts a hand!

👏 Welcome home. 

In the most fitting fashion, their mission, which certified the return of astronaut launches from the U.S., ended with an equally historic nighttime splashdown at 2:56am ET (06:56 UT): https://t.co/xQUMykAB30 https://t.co/pt3lSHkmlH

What are the differences between the SpaceX Crew-1 & Crew-2 Dragon capsules? There are a few modifications: to the propulsion systems, software, a battery upgrade with improved lifetime, and a fly-around capability. @Commercial_Crew manager Steve Stich responds to a question: https://t.co/7XfiHGFi6y
@SmileSimplify No, SpaceX is in the process of building a new Crew Dragon spacecraft for Crew-3.

@IamMissSindy The Dragon capsules are reusable! Our recently launched Crew-2 mission was the first time we’ve flown a reused Crew Dragon spacecraft. They can be reused up to four times totaling five flights for up to 210 days on orbit.

"Everything came together and resulted in these record-breaking times for getting the Dragon out of the water and the crew out of Dragon." — @SpaceX's Hans Koenigsmann on recovery operations following tonight's splashdown of the Crew-1 mission. https://t.co/NmNg2t0OpZ

"All four crew members are doing really well. We got the capsule on board — Resilience on board — SpaceX's recovery ship without any trouble." — Holly Ridings, chief flight director, @NASA_Johnson, on tonight's Crew-1 mission splashdown. https://t.co/koCCG8o1o8
@psbfoto The last and only other nighttime splashdown of a U.S. crewed spacecraft was in 1968 with the return of our Apollo 8 astronauts.
@DeeganDaGoat The Crew-1 mission astronauts spent approximately 167 days on the @Space_Station, completing 2,688 orbits of Earth!
RT @nasahqphoto: Splashdown! The @SpaceX Crew Dragon, Resilience, lands in the Gulf of Mexico after undocking from @Space_Station with Crew…
RT @NASAKennedy: ✅ Mission complete! @Astro_illini, @AstroVicGlover, Shannon Walker and @Astro_Soichi splashed down off the Florida coast a…
